strapiPost.title: UAMS Opens Simulation Center In NWA For Medical Students
strapiPost.content:
Thereâ€™s a new simulation center on the Fayetteville campus of the University of Arkansas for Medical Sciences, enabling state-of-the-art training for students. 

  • Resources for success: All UAMS students in Northwest Arkansas will now be able to use the 3,400 sq. ft simulation center and experience real-world scenarios to aid them in their medical training with features such as high-fidelity manikins to simulate medical emergencies in a full range of ages.
  • Steps of healing: Quality care starts with quality education, and the center offers just that. The simulation center is projected to produce the best and the brightest healthcare professionals in NWA who will provide the highest quality of care for patients in our region.
